Message.Msg: I doubt that. It's already a given that earnings will be maybe OK but it doesn't matter. It's obvious that the biggest risk to this stock is the end of QE which I still don't think is in sight. Everyone knows, even the analysts that won't say so, that AMZN's metrics are horrible across the board but how many ETF's is this stock tied to? How many funds? Didn't Bezos work at a hedge fund? Probably knows a lot about setting a stock to move up wouldn't you say? It's the stock of the future, the golden goose that keeps on giving. By the time it turns over and I still believe it will, it could be $100 north of here before it gets cut in half. Not much would surprise me with this stock. Whether I remain in it or not I have to see what happens because it defies logic. If you short have a long time horizon and don't go nuts. If you buy puts, far out ones (Jan 2014) at the $310 level do not have as much premium and the BE price is about $284. I have not look at 2015 puts. Good luck.
